blocks.text: The rule may be extended to apply to the case of a product of more than two functions $x$. Thus if $u$ and $v$ are each functions of $x$.

blocks.description: This equation expresses the derivative of the product of two functions, indicating how to compute it using the derivatives of each function.

blocks.text:
Example 1.  Suppose $y = x^2 \cdot \log x$. 
Then let $u = x^2$ so that $u' = 2x$ and let $v = \log x$ so that $v' = \frac{1}{x}$.
